intro: Ecbolium maynense, commonly known as the Mexican thornapple, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and hairy leaves. The plant produces showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Ecbolium maynense is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
